title: 4-C/ID Model-Based Training Course for Enhancing Medical Case Presentation Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and understanding of patient care processes
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education utilizing VR simulations in smartphone-dominant limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can present structured medical cases by applying the four phases of the 4-C/ID model: learning tasks, supportive information, just-in-time information, and part-task practice
Learners can present patient symptom-diagnosis-treatment processes with over 80% accuracy in VR simulations mimicking real clinical environments
Learners can revise case presentation content at least twice based on peer feedback and achieve a grade of B or higher in final project evaluations

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
